intro: Staehelina fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a distinctive fringed margin, and the flowers are usually yellow or orange. Staehelina fimbriata is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
